properties.site-address: Lymington Garage, High Street, Lymington

properties.name: BLR_Lymi_004

properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority
properties.site-address: Buckland Granaries, Sway Road, Lymington

properties.name: BLR_Lymi_005
properties.notes: The site is a former police station building but the police has relocated to another premises within the town so the service will continue to be provided in an equally accessible location. Suitable for residential development and given its location and character of adjacent buildings, the site has potential for 20 flats
properties.ownership-status: owned by a public authority
properties.site-address: Former Police Station Site, Southampton Road, Lymington

properties.name: BLR_Lymi_006
properties.notes: This site is currently in use as a builder’s merchant but the occupier is interested in making the site available for residential-led redevelopment. The builder's merchant use is not particularly appropriate for the site given its close proximity to residential properties that adjoin the site. Given its location the site has potential for high density residential-led mixed use development. The adopted Local Plan Part 2 (2014) currently identifies this site as a town centre office opportunity (LYM8.6) and that other uses may be acceptable on upper floors
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority
properties.site-address: Jewsons Depot, Gosport Street, Lymington

properties.name: BLR_Lymi_007
properties.notes: This site is comprised of a three storey office block and car park owned by the Council and is on the northern edge of Lymington town centre. Given its location on the edge of the town centre, the character of the site and the immediate area adjacent to the site, this site has significant potential to accommodate mixed-use development at a high density. The adopted Local Plan Part 2 (2014) currently identifies this site as a town centre opportunity (LYM8.4)
properties.ownership-status: owned by a public authority
properties.site-address: Town Hall, Avenue Road, Lymington

properties.ownership-status: owned by a public authority
properties.site-address: Fernmount House & Centre, Forest Pines, New Milton

properties.name: BLR_Newm_007
properties.notes: Permission reference: 18/10198. One block of 9 two-bedroom flats and 1 one-bedroom flat
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority
properties.site-address: Site of 21 Kennard Road, New Milton

properties.name: BLR_Newm_008
properties.notes: This is a town centre site that currently functions as the railway station car park, a car hire yard and storage area. There is an opportunity to optimise this site and make the most effective use of land through a well-designed residential-led redevelopment scheme. Redevelopment would have potential to bring visual/economic/social enhancements and make best use of a prominent town centre site. Development would need to ensure the proper functioning of the station and station car park is not undermined. Potential for high density residential development of four storeys in principle
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority
properties.site-address: Land south of New Milton Station, New Milton

properties.name: BLR_Newm_009
properties.notes: This site is currently occupied by a range of commercial uses including a builders merchant and a car repair garage. There is an opportunity for redevelopment that can optimise the site and bring visual/environmental enhancements to this prominent gateway site to New Milton town centre. Given its town centre location, the site could accommodate a well-designed high density mixed-use scheme comprising commercial uses on the ground floor and residential uses on upper floors. Redevelopment would have potential to bring visual/economic/social enhancements to New Milton town centre
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority
properties.site-address: Land south of Manor Road, New Milton

properties.name: BLR_Newm_010
properties.notes: This town centre site is currently in use as a car park and as a car repair/sales garage. There is an opportunity for redevelopment of the site that optimises the use of the site and makes most efficient use of land. The Listed Broadway Tower will be an important consideration in any development proposal. Given its town centre location, the site could accommodate a well-designed high density mixed-use scheme comprising commercial uses on the ground floor and residential uses on upper floors. Redevelopment would have potential to bring visual/economic/social enhancements to New Milton town centre
properties.ownership-status: mixed ownership
properties.site-address: Land north of Osborne Road, New Milton

properties.name: BLR_Newm_011
properties.notes: This site is comprised of a car park and the former Co-op supermarket building. There is an opportunity for redevelopment of the site that optimises the use of the site and makes most efficient use of land. Given its town centre location, the site could accommodate a well-designed high density mixed-use scheme comprising commercial uses on the ground floor and residential uses on upper floors. Redevelopment would have potential to bring visual/economic/social enhancements to New Milton town centre
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority
properties.site-address: Land at Station Road/Spencer Road, New Milton

properties.name: BLR_Newm_012
properties.notes: This site is located at the southern end of New Milton town centre. Given its town centre location, the site could accommodate a well-designed high density mixed-use scheme comprising commercial uses on the ground floor and residential uses on upper floors. The site offers an opportunity for the development of a landmark building to make a positive contribution to the town. Redevelopment would have potential to bring visual/economic/social enhancements to New Milton town centre
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority
properties.site-address: Land at Station Road/Elm Avenue, New Milton

This permisssion has lapsed

properties.name: BLR_Ringw_007

Appropriate mixed-use redevelopment of the site would be appropriate and would likely bring visual/environmental enhancements, particularly in the car park/service yard in the rear part of the site

properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

properties.name: BLR_Tott_004
properties.notes: Adopted Local Plan Allocation TOT11. Adopted Local Plan Allocation. Potential capacity of around 400 dwellings subject to an appropriate scheme of habitat mitigation and a high quality design, and assuming some elements of employment/commercial use on the main road frontage
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority
properties.site-address: Land at Eling Wharf, Totton

properties.name: BLR_Tott_005
properties.notes: Permission reference: 17/11651. 10 flats, 5 pairs of semi-detached houses
properties.ownership-status: owned by a public authority
properties.site-address: Stocklands Site, Calmore Drive, Totton

properties.name: BLR_Tott_006
properties.notes: This town centre site offers opportunity for comprehensive mixed-use redevelopment and significant enhancements to the whole site including the construction of a new frontage building of three or four storeys on the south west corner of the site as set out in the Totton Town Centre SPG, and on the north west corner of the site. The south east corner of the site (Units 41-43) was granted planning permisssion (19/10571) in January 2020 for a three storey building comprised of 9 flats with flexible commercial/community uses on the ground floor. The remainder of the site has potential to accommodate a further 20 flats which could be appropriately located in the areas of the site that are in Flood Zone 1
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority
properties.site-address: Totton Shopping Centre, Totton

properties.name: BLR_Tott_007
properties.notes: This site is situated on Commercial Road and is currently comprised of a disused yard, social club building, a commercial unit and a pair of semi-detached dwellings. The site is currently underused. This site offers potential for mixed-use development (for example commercial uses on ground floor and residential on the upper floor(s)). Well-designed development will have the potential to bring visual/environmental enhancements. The British Legion social club should be re-provided on site as part of any redevelopment scheme or in an equally accessible town centre location in Totton
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority
properties.site-address: 81-95 Commercial Road
